Semi-strong form means all publicly available information — like earnings announcements or news — is already priced in. Strong form says even insider information is instantly reflected, though in reality, markets rarely reach that level."
"The goal of this simulation is to see how quickly prices adjust after an event."

personalized_feedback:
Alejandro — I want to start by calling out how clearly you’ve moved from ad hoc intuition to a DRIVER-style, systematic thinker. Your work showed concrete strengths: you consistently tied model drivers (revenue growth, margins, working capital) back to business levers, and you built repeatable logic flows that made the valuation and forecast steps traceable. That ability to map financial outcomes to operational inputs — and to keep the chain of cause → effect visible — is exactly the transformation we aim for.

Now, next steps to turn that progress into real-world impact. For technical implementation, you’re making headway but can sharpen reproducibility and validation. Practical moves: modularize your models so each block (revenue, COGS, capex, WC) can be run and audited independently; add simple validation checks (e.g., balance sheet reconciliations, cash-flow sign checks) and a short “assumption sheet” that peers can review. Business payoff: models that are auditable and modular get accepted faster by FP&A teams, investors, and acquirers.

For communication, focus on distilling the story for decision makers. Convert your full analysis into a one-page executive summary that highlights the top 3 sensitivities, a best/worst/base scenario, and the single most important operational lever. Complement this with one chart that shows how a change in that lever moves NPV or free cash flow. That makes your analytical rigor actionable for a CFO or board.

Keep going — systematic thinking is a career multiplier. The habit of tracing outcomes to drivers will make you invaluable in FP&A, corporate strategy, and investor conversations. This journey is ongoing; each model you tighten and each story you sharpen compounds. I’m excited to see where you take this next.
